TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FullTrustAssembliesSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Configures a set of full-trust assemblies. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FullTrustAssembliesSection class enables you to specify full-trust assemblies within an ASP.NET partial-trust application domain.
To configure an assembly, you must have the hexadecimal string representation of its public key. You get this key by using the Strong Name (Sn.exe) tool. This tool produces the public-key hexadecimal string representation that you use in configuration. It also produces the public-key token. For more information, see [Sn.exe (Strong Name Tool)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to specify a full-trust assembly by using the `fullTrustAssemblies` section in a configuration file.
``` <fullTrustAssemblies> <add assemblyName="MyAssembly" version="1.0.0.0" publicKey="hex_key_representation" /> </fullTrustAssemblies> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the collection of the fully trusted assemblies.
Docs.value: A collection of fully trusted assemblies.
